message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG

This paper deals with the problem of calibrating multiple cameras with different viewpoints, resolutions, and fields of view. This is a common problem in computer vision, and specifically in the field of multi-view geometry. The paper focuses on the calibration of time-of-flight (TOF) cameras, which provide depth information, and color cameras, which provide photometric information. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of the calibrated cameras for automatic scene interpretation, which suggests that it may also belong to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. The paper also presents a new evaluation procedure, which involves decomposing the reprojection error into calibration and sensor-dependent components. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the problem of merging depth and color information, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories.
